hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity-Sensitive Mean Reversion in 'Blue Chip' Alts
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime with recovering liquidity, large-cap altcoins (ETH, SOL) that experience an extreme, low-volume selloff (-8% in 24h on volume <80% of 20-day avg) will mean-revert sharply within 48 hours as liquidity normalization facilitates efficient price discovery.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low-volume selloffs in a stabilizing liquidity environment are often inefficient and driven by isolated large orders, not sustained selling pressure. As general market liquidity recovers, these anomalies are quickly corrected.
entry_conditions: Asset (ETH or SOL) drops ≥8% in 24h on spot volume <80% of its 20-day average
24h RSI for the asset falls below 30
Crypto Fear & Greed Index is >30 (not extreme fear)
Aggregate stablecoin market cap (USDT+USDC) is flat or increasing over past 3 days

exit_conditions.take_profit: +5% gain from entry price OR RSI crosses above 50
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes a new 24h low after entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The asset continues to decline on increasing volume after the signal, indicating the move was fundamental/structural, not a liquidity anomaly.
